alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 9:32PM EDT until April 09 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Georgia... Chattahoochee River at Columbus affecting Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Lee and Russell Counties. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Columbus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River at Columbus. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the 14th Street bridge. Portions of the River Walk in Columbus begin to flood and will be closed to the public. The water level continues to approach the foundation of the Phenix City Amphitheater in Alabama. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Thursday /9:15 PM EDT Thursday/ the stage was 26.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 27.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 27 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
